en.meaningText: The ğŸ (spaghetti) emoji depicts a plate of spaghetti noodles with a fork. It is most commonly used to represent spaghetti, pasta, Italy, or Italian food. In some contexts, it can also be used as slang for 'noods,' which is a playful reference to 'nudes.'
en.usageText: The ğŸ emoji is widely used to talk about pasta and Italian cuisine. It's often paired with other emojis like ğŸ• (pizza) and the Italian flag ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹ to refer to Italy. On October 17 and 25, it is used with hashtags like #NationalPastaDay and #WorldPastaDay to celebrate these holidays. It can also be combined with ğŸ¤Œ to express that the food is delicious.
en.historyText: The Spaghetti emoji ğŸ was approved under Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and was added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.
en.storyText: The word 'macaroni' in the famous song 'Yankee Doodle' was used to mock an 18th-century English dandy who had adopted an exaggerated Italian style. This is an amusing historical context for the term. There are also funny stories on the internet about people misinterpreting emoji combinations like ğŸ¤ŒğŸ.
